title: How to Make Russian Tea Cakes

steps.headline: Place the butter in a bowl along with the confectioner’s sugar.
Mix the two ingredients in a mixing bowl using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
steps.description: The finished mixture should look creamy with a light yellow color.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla and beat the butter mixture for an additional 30 seconds.
Place the flour and kosher salt into another clean mixing bowl.
Scoop 1/2 of the flour and salt into a sifter or a sieve using a spoon.
steps.description: Position the sifter or sieve over an additional clean bowl.

steps.headline: Turn the sifter handle or tap the sieve until the flour and salt have gone through the mesh and into the mixing bowl.
Add 1/3 of the sifted flour and salt to the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Beat them until they are just combined.

steps.headline: Place an additional 1/3 of the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Repeat the mixing process with the remaining ingredients.
Fold in the pecans using a wooden spoon or large flat plastic spatula.
Remove the cookie dough from the mixing bowl and shape it into a disc.
Cover the dough in plastic wrap.
Place the dough in the refrigerator and chill it for 15 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Remove the chilled dough from the refrigerator and shape the dough into 1" balls, doing your best to make the shapes as uniform as possible.
Place the cookies onto the baking sheets, allowing 1-1/2" of space between the cookies and the edges of the pan.
Bake one sheet of cookies for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Then, turn the pan at a 90-degree angle and bake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes. The cookies should be set and only lightly browned.

steps.headline: Cool the cookies for 2 minutes before removing them from the baking pan with a spatula.
Put the other sheet of cookies into the oven, cooking for 10 to 12 minutes and turning the baking sheet once during the cooking process.
Fill a shallow dish with powdered sugar.
As you remove each cookie from the baking sheet, roll it in the powdered sugar using clean, dry hands.
steps.description: Add additional powdered sugar to the dish as needed to make sure that all of the cookies are covered in sugar.

steps.headline: Place the cookies on a wire rack to cool.
Serve the cookies with a steaming cup of black tea sweetened with black cherry compote.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can store them in tins or in airtight containers for up to a week.

Prepare the Dough Place the butter in a bowl along with the confectioner’s sugar. Mix the two ingredients in a mixing bowl using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment. The finished mixture should look creamy with a light yellow color. Add the vanilla and beat the butter mixture for an additional 30 seconds. Place the flour and kosher salt into another clean mixing bowl. Scoop 1/2 of the flour and salt into a sifter or a sieve using a spoon. Position the sifter or sieve over an additional clean bowl. Turn the sifter handle or tap the sieve until the flour and salt have gone through the mesh and into the mixing bowl. Add 1/3 of the sifted flour and salt to the wet ingredients. Beat them until they are just combined. Place an additional 1/3 of the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Repeat the mixing process with the remaining ingredients. Fold in the pecans using a wooden spoon or large flat plastic spatula. Chill the Dough Remove the cookie dough from the mixing bowl and shape it into a disc. Cover the dough in plastic wrap. Place the dough in the refrigerator and chill it for 15 minutes. Place the cookies onto the baking sheets, allowing 1-1/2" of space between the cookies and the edges of the pan. Bake one sheet of cookies for 5 minutes. Then, turn the pan at a 90-degree angle and bake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes. The cookies should be set and only lightly browned. Cool the cookies for 2 minutes before removing them from the baking pan with a spatula. Put the other sheet of cookies into the oven, cooking for 10 to 12 minutes and turning the baking sheet once during the cooking process. Fill a shallow dish with powdered sugar. As you remove each cookie from the baking sheet, roll it in the powdered sugar using clean, dry hands. Add additional powdered sugar to the dish as needed to make sure that all of the cookies are covered in sugar. Place the cookies on a wire rack to cool. Serve the cookies with a steaming cup of black tea sweetened with black cherry compote. Alternatively, you can store them in tins or in airtight containers for up to a week.
